content.description: Sit start same as Reason. Exit direct. Between Reason and Press Release on the slopers.

Sample beta: Start matched in the mini "cave" on the jug then cross your right hand to the slot to your upper left. Lock off and reach your left hand out of the cave to a decent mini jug. Bring your right hand into the slot to the right of your left hand. Make the far reach out left to the large jug rail. Match the rail, and move your right hand up to the mini bump on the top face of the boulder. Make the fairly large move up to the crimp located up and left from your right hand. Bump left to the next crimp, then bring your right hand in to the adjacent crimp. Move your left hand up to the next crimp to your upper left, then move your right hand up to the sloper to your upper right, then top out.
content.location: Located on the southwestern face of the Inverted Boulder. Start inside the mini cave on the jug.

content.description:
Sit start at the opening jug for Inverted Siberian Huskey, but instead of traversing left as for that route climb up the short face on the trail.  

  This route is only 4 or 5 moves long but it packs a punch. Start in the jug and move out to a good crimp with your right hand. Situate your feet and cross left hand into the vertical crimp above your right hand (crux?). Then move your right hand up to the decent vertical crimp a bit above you left. Pick feet and make a long move to a sloper at the top out (crux?)
content.location: Start at the same jug Inverted Siberian Huskey and climb up the face right on the trail. This climbs the same face as Abandon All Hope.

content.description:
The crux of this route is the top out which is nerve racking because you are at least 20 feet off the gorund. Stand start at obvious jugs the the middle of the face. Meander up the face with a slight rightward trend. Following the path of least resistence reach the top in a shallow v and top out. 

  This route is still dirty.
content.location: In the middle of the face that faces the Moat boulders start on obvious jugs.

content.description: Sit start on a large jug and traverse left on the seam that gradually gets smaller and much more crimpy, the feet are all over the place in the seam below the seem and I have even seen someone use a foot above the seam but that never made much sense to me. If you leave the seam before it ends it reduces the grade drastically, the top out is slopey but if you inspect it before and find the right holds it will not be as difficult as a topout as it looks, but don't get me wrong it is defiantly a hard sustained route.
content.location: This isn't on either of the moat boulder but it is close. Walk past the moat boulders and about thirty feet past them there will be another boulder walk around to the backside of it following the path and you will see this problem.

content.description:
Stand start on obvious under-cling and move right following the overlap using another undercling. When the overlap ends, go straight up and mantle(crux) to the top out. 

  The underclings you use feel a little suspect but held me.
content.location: When you first reach the Inverted Boulder there is a tree growing right on the trail and touching the rock this route starts just to the right of this tree.

content.description:
Start on the juggs of Inverted Siberian Huskey (V5) that are just past the corner. Squat start of the jugs and make a long move to a crimp then move your other hand up to a crimp right next to it. Now you encounter the crux, mantle on small crimps and slopers to the top. 

  The crux is made difficult by the bulging nature of the climb.
content.location: Start on the large jugs just past the corner of the route traverse Inverted Siberian Huskey (V5), then climb straight up manlting the buldge.

content.description:
Climb huge holds up the arete. The holds are all large and flat. The route is a little mossy but it can still easily be done.  

  This can be used as a down climb, a way to get to the top of the boulder, or a fun climb in itself.
content.protection: Pad and spotter there is a large rocka t the landing.
content.location: Located on the left arete on the same side as Inverted Siberian Huskey (V5).

content.description:
Sit start on a nice high undercling with your left hand get your right hand on a crap crimp lift off the ground and get more crappy crimps to the top 

  The left starting was broken by Matt Wallace but it is still doable
content.location: About 8 ft. to the right of Inverted Siberian Husky

content.description: This boulder holds the classic Inverted Siberian Huskey V5. There is potential for development, it has only 6 established lines on it but there is room for many more. This boulder is unigue because it has all different types of climbing from highballs, to low traverses.
